org.ow2.chameleon.testing.helpers

Class ChameleonOption

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ow2.chameleon.testing.helpers.ChameleonOption
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.ops4j.pax.exam.Option, org.ops4j.pax.exam.options.CompositeOption

    public class ChameleonOption
extends Object
implements org.ops4j.pax.exam.options.CompositeOption
    Pax Exam Option to deploy a chameleon. The chameleon must be unzipped somewhere. This is generally done using the maven-dependency-plugin: 
     <plugin>
   <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
   <artifactId>maven-dependency-plugin</artifactId>
   <executions>
       <execution>
           <id>unzip-chameleon</id>
           <phase>compile</phase>
           <goals>
               <goal>unpack-dependencies</goal>
           </goals>
           <configuration>
               <outputDirectory>${project.build.directory}/chameleon</outputDirectory>
               <overWriteReleases>false</overWriteReleases>
               <overWriteSnapshots>true</overWriteSnapshots>
               <excludeTransitive>true</excludeTransitive>
               <includeArtifactIds>CHAMELEON</includeArtifactIds>
               <includeTypes>zip</includeTypes>
           </configuration>
       </execution>
   </executions>
 </plugin>
    Once the chameleon is unzipped, this option takes care to configure the chameleon correctly:
    • configure the boot classpath and expose chameleon packages
    • deploy bundles from core, runtime and application
    • configuration of the deploy folder
    • deploy the osgi-helper
    • loads the chameleon properties and system.properties
    Chameleon properties and system properties can be overridden / extended using chameleonProperties(Hashtable) and chameleonSystemProperties(Hashtable)
